intro: Diapedium unguiculatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diapedium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Diapedium unguiculatum is often found in temperate regions of Asia and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
